snippet: The state of Wyoming and mining and timber interests had challenged a 2001 rule prohibiting road construction on some 58.5 million acres, mainly out West.
abstract: The state of Wyoming and mining and timber interests had challenged a 2001 rule prohibiting road construction on some 58.5 million acres, mainly out West.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court has refused to question an appeals court decision affirming the federal government’s right to issue a roadless rule to protect 58.5 million acres of forest lands in 38 states. The rule, issued in the final days of the Clinton administration, was challenged by the state of Wyoming and mining and cattle interests.

headline.main: Supreme Court Leaves Roadless Rule Intact
